26class Heap;

31
32// LocalHeap is used by the GC to track all threads with heap access in order to
33// stop them before performing a collection. LocalHeaps can be either Parked or
34// Running and are in Parked mode when initialized.
35// Running: Thread is allowed to access the heap but needs to give the GC the
36// chance to run regularly by manually invoking Safepoint(). The
37// thread can be parked using ParkedScope.
38// Parked: Heap access is not allowed, so the GC will not stop this thread
39// for a collection. Useful when threads do not need heap access for
40// some time or for blocking operations like locking a mutex.
41class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE LocalHeap {
42 public:
43 using GCEpilogueCallback = void(void*);
44
45 explicit LocalHeap(
46 Heap* heap, ThreadKind kind,
47 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> persistent_handles = nullptr);
48 ~LocalHeap();
49
50 // Frequently invoked by local thread to check whether safepoint was requested
51 // from the main thread.
52 void Safepoint() {
53 DCHECK(AllowSafepoints::IsAllowed());
54 ThreadState current = state_.load_relaxed();
55
56 if (V8_UNLIKELY(current.IsRunningWithSlowPathFlag())) {
57 SafepointSlowPath();
58 }
59 }
60
61 LocalHandles* handles() { return handles_.get(); }
62
63 template <typename T>
64 Handle<T> NewPersistentHandle(Tagged<T> object) {
65 if (!persistent_handles_) {
66 EnsurePersistentHandles();
67 }
68 return persistent_handles_->NewHandle(object);
69 }
70
71 template <typename T>
72 Handle<T> NewPersistentHandle(Handle<T> object) {
73 return NewPersistentHandle(*object);
74 }
75
76 template <typename T>
77 Handle<T> NewPersistentHandle(T object) {
78 static_assert(kTaggedCanConvertToRawObjects);
79 return NewPersistentHandle(Tagged<T>(object));
80 }
81
82 template <typename T>
83 MaybeHandle<T> NewPersistentMaybeHandle(MaybeHandle<T> maybe_handle) {
84 Handle<T> handle;
85 if (maybe_handle.ToHandle(&handle)) {
86 return NewPersistentHandle(handle);
87 }
88 return kNullMaybeHandle;
89 }
90
91 void AttachPersistentHandles(
92 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> persistent_handles);
93 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> DetachPersistentHandles();
94#ifdef DEBUG
95 bool HasPersistentHandles() { return !!persistent_handles_; }
96 bool ContainsPersistentHandle(Address* location);
97 bool ContainsLocalHandle(Address* location);
98 bool IsHandleDereferenceAllowed();
99#endif
100
101 bool IsParked() const;
102 bool IsRunning() const;
103
104 Heap* heap() const { return heap_; }
105 Heap* AsHeap() const { return heap(); }
106
107 // Heap root getters.
108#define ROOT_ACCESSOR(type, name, CamelName) inline Tagged<type> name();
109 MUTABLE_ROOT_LIST(ROOT_ACCESSOR)
110#undef ROOT_ACCESSOR
111
112 MarkingBarrier* marking_barrier() { return marking_barrier_.get(); }
113
114 // Give up all LABs. Used for e.g. full GCs.
115 void FreeLinearAllocationAreas();
116
117#if DEBUG
118 void VerifyLinearAllocationAreas() const;
119#endif // DEBUG
120
121 // Make all LABs iterable.
122 void MakeLinearAllocationAreasIterable();
123
124 // Mark/Unmark all LABs except for new and shared space. Use for black
125 // allocation.
126 void MarkLinearAllocationAreasBlack();
127 void UnmarkLinearAllocationsArea();
128
129 // Mark/Unmark linear allocation areas in shared heap black. Used for black
130 // allocation.
131 void MarkSharedLinearAllocationAreasBlack();
132 void UnmarkSharedLinearAllocationsArea();
133
134 // Fetches a pointer to the local heap from the thread local storage.
135 // It is intended to be used in handle and write barrier code where it is
136 // difficult to get a pointer to the current instance of local heap otherwise.
137 // The result may be a nullptr if there is no local heap instance associated
138 // with the current thread.
139 static LocalHeap* Current();
140
141#ifdef DEBUG
142 void VerifyCurrent() const;
143#endif

145 // Allocate an uninitialized object.
146 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT inline AllocationResult AllocateRaw(
147 int size_in_bytes, AllocationType allocation,
148 AllocationOrigin origin = AllocationOrigin::kRuntime,
149 AllocationAlignment alignment = kTaggedAligned);
150
151 // Allocate an uninitialized object.
152 enum AllocationRetryMode { kLightRetry, kRetryOrFail };
153 template <AllocationRetryMode mode>
154 Tagged<HeapObject> AllocateRawWith(
155 int size_in_bytes, AllocationType allocation,
156 AllocationOrigin origin = AllocationOrigin::kRuntime,
157 AllocationAlignment alignment = kTaggedAligned);
158
159 // Allocates an uninitialized object and crashes when object
160 // cannot be allocated.
161 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT inline Address AllocateRawOrFail(
162 int size_in_bytes, AllocationType allocation,
163 AllocationOrigin origin = AllocationOrigin::kRuntime,
164 AllocationAlignment alignment = kTaggedAligned);
165
166 void NotifyObjectSizeChange(Tagged<HeapObject> object, int old_size,
167 int new_size,
168 ClearRecordedSlots clear_recorded_slots);
169
170 bool is_main_thread() const { return is_main_thread_; }
171 bool is_main_thread_for(Heap* heap) const {
172 return is_main_thread() && heap_ == heap;
173 }
174 bool is_in_trampoline() const { return heap_->stack().IsMarkerSet(); }
175 bool deserialization_complete() const {
176 return heap_->deserialization_complete();
177 }
178 ReadOnlySpace* read_only_space() { return heap_->read_only_space(); }
179
180 // Adds a callback that is invoked with the given |data| after each GC.
181 // The callback is invoked on the main thread before any background thread
182 // resumes. The callback must not allocate or make any other calls that
183 // can trigger GC.
184 void AddGCEpilogueCallback(GCEpilogueCallback* callback, void* data,
185 GCCallbacksInSafepoint::GCType gc_type =
186 GCCallbacksInSafepoint::GCType::kAll);
187 void RemoveGCEpilogueCallback(GCEpilogueCallback* callback, void* data);
188
189 // Weakens StrongDescriptorArray objects into regular DescriptorArray objects.
190 void WeakenDescriptorArrays(
191 GlobalHandleVector<DescriptorArray> strong_descriptor_arrays);
192
193 // Used to make SetupMainThread() available to unit tests.
194 void SetUpMainThreadForTesting();
195
196 // Execute the callback while the local heap is parked. All threads must
197 // always park via this method, not directly with `ParkedScope`. The callback
198 // is only allowed to execute blocking operations.
199 //
200 // The callback must be a callable object, expecting either no parameters or a
201 // const ParkedScope&, which serves as a witness for parking. The first
202 // variant checks if we are on the main thread or not. Use the other two
203 // variants if this already known.
204 template <typename Callback>
205 V8_INLINE void BlockWhileParked(Callback callback);
206 template <typename Callback>
207 V8_INLINE void BlockMainThreadWhileParked(Callback callback);
208 template <typename Callback>
209 V8_INLINE void BlockBackgroundThreadWhileParked(Callback callback);
210
211 private:
212 using ParkedBit = base::BitField8<bool, 0, 1>;
213 using SafepointRequestedBit = ParkedBit::Next<bool, 1>;
214 using CollectionRequestedBit = SafepointRequestedBit::Next<bool, 1>;
215
216 class ThreadState final {
217 public:
218 static constexpr ThreadState Parked() {
219 return ThreadState(ParkedBit::kMask);
220 }
221 static constexpr ThreadState Running() { return ThreadState(0); }
222
223 constexpr bool IsRunning() const { return !ParkedBit::decode(raw_state_); }
224
225 constexpr ThreadState SetRunning() const V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT {
226 return ThreadState(raw_state_ & ~ParkedBit::kMask);
227 }
228
229 constexpr bool IsParked() const { return ParkedBit::decode(raw_state_); }
230
231 constexpr ThreadState SetParked() const V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT {
232 return ThreadState(ParkedBit::kMask | raw_state_);
233 }
234
235 constexpr bool IsSafepointRequested() const {
236 return SafepointRequestedBit::decode(raw_state_);
237 }
238
239 constexpr bool IsCollectionRequested() const {
240 return CollectionRequestedBit::decode(raw_state_);
241 }
242
243 constexpr bool IsRunningWithSlowPathFlag() const {
244 return IsRunning() && (raw_state_ & (SafepointRequestedBit::kMask |
245 CollectionRequestedBit::kMask));
246 }
247
248 private:
249 constexpr explicit ThreadState(uint8_t value) : raw_state_(value) {}
250
251 constexpr uint8_t raw() const { return raw_state_; }
252
253 uint8_t raw_state_;
254
255 friend class LocalHeap;
256 };
257
258 class AtomicThreadState final {
259 public:
260 constexpr explicit AtomicThreadState(ThreadState state)
261 : raw_state_(state.raw()) {}
262
263 bool CompareExchangeStrong(ThreadState& expected, ThreadState updated) {
264 return raw_state_.compare_exchange_strong(expected.raw_state_,
265 updated.raw());
266 }
267
268 bool CompareExchangeWeak(ThreadState& expected, ThreadState updated) {
269 return raw_state_.compare_exchange_weak(expected.raw_state_,
270 updated.raw());
271 }
272
273 ThreadState SetParked() {
274 return ThreadState(raw_state_.fetch_or(ParkedBit::kMask));
275 }
276
277 ThreadState SetSafepointRequested() {
278 return ThreadState(raw_state_.fetch_or(SafepointRequestedBit::kMask));
279 }
280
281 ThreadState ClearSafepointRequested() {
282 return ThreadState(raw_state_.fetch_and(~SafepointRequestedBit::kMask));
283 }
284
285 ThreadState SetCollectionRequested() {
286 return ThreadState(raw_state_.fetch_or(CollectionRequestedBit::kMask));
287 }
288
289 ThreadState ClearCollectionRequested() {
290 return ThreadState(raw_state_.fetch_and(~CollectionRequestedBit::kMask));
291 }
292
293 ThreadState load_relaxed() const {
294 return ThreadState(raw_state_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed));
295 }
296
297 private:
298 std::atomic<uint8_t> raw_state_;
299 };
300
301 // Slow path of allocation that performs GC and then retries allocation in
302 // loop.
303 AllocationResult PerformCollectionAndAllocateAgain(
304 int object_size, AllocationType type, AllocationOrigin origin,
305 AllocationAlignment alignment);
306
307#ifdef DEBUG
308 bool IsSafeForConservativeStackScanning() const;
309#endif
310
311 template <typename Callback>
312 V8_INLINE void ExecuteWithStackMarker(Callback callback);
313
314 void Park() {
315 DCHECK(AllowSafepoints::IsAllowed());
316 DCHECK(IsSafeForConservativeStackScanning());
317 ThreadState expected = ThreadState::Running();
318 if (!state_.CompareExchangeWeak(expected, ThreadState::Parked())) {
319 ParkSlowPath();
320 }
321 }
322
323 void Unpark() {
324 DCHECK(AllowSafepoints::IsAllowed());
325 ThreadState expected = ThreadState::Parked();
326 if (!state_.CompareExchangeWeak(expected, ThreadState::Running())) {
327 UnparkSlowPath();
328 }
329 }
330
331 void ParkSlowPath();
332 void UnparkSlowPath();
333 void EnsureParkedBeforeDestruction();
334 void SafepointSlowPath();
335 void SleepInSafepoint();
336 void SleepInUnpark();
337
338 template <typename Callback>
339 V8_INLINE void ParkAndExecuteCallback(Callback callback);
340
341 void EnsurePersistentHandles();
342
343 void InvokeGCEpilogueCallbacksInSafepoint(
344 GCCallbacksInSafepoint::GCType gc_type);
345
346 // Set up this LocalHeap as main thread.
347 void SetUpMainThread(LinearAllocationArea& new_allocation_info,
348 LinearAllocationArea& old_allocation_info);
349
350 void SetUpMarkingBarrier();
351 void SetUpSharedMarking();
352
353 Heap* heap_;
354 V8_NO_UNIQUE_ADDRESS PtrComprCageAccessScope ptr_compr_cage_access_scope_;
355 bool is_main_thread_;
356
357 AtomicThreadState state_;
358
359 bool allocation_failed_;
360 bool main_thread_parked_;
361
362 LocalHeap* prev_;
363 LocalHeap* next_;
364
365 std::unique_ptr<LocalHandles> handles_;
366 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> persistent_handles_;
367 std::unique_ptr<MarkingBarrier> marking_barrier_;
368
369 GCCallbacksInSafepoint gc_epilogue_callbacks_;
370
371 HeapAllocator heap_allocator_;
372
373 MarkingBarrier* saved_marking_barrier_ = nullptr;
374
375 // Stack information for the thread using this local heap.
376 ::heap::base::Stack stack_;
377
378 friend class CollectionBarrier;
379 friend class GlobalSafepoint;
380 friend class Heap;
381 friend class Isolate;
382 friend class IsolateSafepoint;
383 friend class IsolateSafepointScope;
384 friend class ParkedScope;
385 friend class UnparkedScope;
386};
